qas.question: What year was the Battle of Gettysburg?
What Brigade was the 24th Michigan Infantry Regiment a part of?
How many casualties did the 24th Michigan Infantry Regiment have in Gettysburg?

context: Numerous men from Detroit volunteered to fight for the Union during the American Civil War, including the 24th Michigan Infantry Regiment (part of the legendary <a2_0>Iron Brigade<a2_0/>), which fought with distinction and suffered <a3_0>82%<a3_0/> casualties at the Battle of Gettysburg in <a0_0>1863<a0_0/>. When the First Volunteer Infantry Regiment arrived to fortify Washington, DC, President Abraham Lincoln is quoted as saying "Thank God for Michigan!" <a1_0>George Armstrong Custer<a1_0/> led the Michigan Brigade during the Civil War and called them the "Wolverines".
